after three nights of pub crawls, german themed nights of cheap beer, and a night of JD and coke to celebrate Jack Daniels birthday, am contemplating a quiet night, or at least a night of no drinking, because to me, right now, that sounds like a gooood idea.

LoVe is in air...or on our tv sets at least, sorry, corny i know, but if the vm people didn't want people to make puns on the peoples names then they should have given them different names. i'm happy it has to be said, veronica and logan are back together which....oh....just makes me so happy *grins manically*, one of my ships is working, and one of my ships have ended the season together, which is more than i can say for most of the other tv shows i watch.

okay so once i've got over the whole logan/veronica thing, i have to admit the episode was a little wierd. the whole cassidy going from being a timid little idiot, to a guy who sent a bus load of kids of a bridge, ran over someone, attempted to kill veronica, screamed 'my name is cassidy' (which to me seems for foolish and girlie than beaver) and jumps to his death. thing is i read the spoilers that it was him a while ago so i guess i've had time to adjust, but there has always been something not quite right about our little beaver.

the whole keith thing was kinda sad, but he was never going to be dead, so i guess i wasn't too hit by it, i was still squeeing over the whole veronica/logan him being there for her etc. anyway, enough of a ramble, am waiting to watch the train wreck that will be the gilmore girls season 6 finale.

in another news, grey's. grey's. grey's. grey's. was a good episode although after watching it, and seeing the previews for next week, am angry with mcdreamy, but am completely in love with chris o'donnell, his character is just....oh, i love him. 

prayers this morning was highly amusing for once, it was a sixth form house talking about children's literature etc, and even the readers started cracking up in the middle of Dr. Seuss' 'Green Eggs And Ham.' the most amusing part had to be however, the 'Nellie The Elephant,' Remix. i was there was some sort of wailing, and some very fast singing, and some odd mumbling, it was hysterical, but more than a little disturbing.

in other news, i ate my first proper apple in two and a half years yesterday. loving the whole no braces thing. *smooshes orthodontist*

my mother is in hospital. she sent me a text mentioning something about being in ESNET in a text, which after an internet search and a battle to decifer the turkish, turns out to be a hastanesi (read - hospital), after she fell down some stepp stone steps hiting her head and back. fortunately the main doctor there was a brain surgeon (and yes i had mcdreamy thoughts, cause, well, he's hot. until managed to refocus on the whole hospital thing) and she's okay, in a lot of pain and bruised but no lasting damage, although she didn throw into the conversation that she's been having dizzy spells for a while. perfect thing to tell your daughter however many thousands of miles away, to stop her worrying, * head/palm*, especially as tom has buggered off to san diego, no idea why, or why he couldn't have gone three weeks ago, other than the fact that i was at home and he enjoys making my life a living hell.

John C. McGinley:

as a very odd term approaches its final week, - thank god -, exhaustion is setting in, deadlines are approaching, and...men are w*nking behind the boarding house. life is complete. what better way to end what can only be described as a very bizarre term, than the cops showing up at the front door as the kitchen staff had a very nasty surprise when they went to leave the house today. apparantly knowing that there were 60 teenage girls in the house, was too much for him and as a result he got caught with his trousers down, literally. the matrons have since gone round and warned everyone to make sure their blinds are fully down before getting changed, so as to avoid a repeat incident. i really don't understand the men that do this, and it's not as if it's the first time this has happened, i think the majority of us have had someone do it outside their boarding house here at least twice during our time here. i still want to know how the one at glenlee managed to get over the very pointy, reasonably high railing with his pants around his ankles and still manage to avoid a masty injury, shown by the fact he promptly went and repeated his actions outside st mags before finally getting caught.

spoke to my mum today, as if i wasn't home sick enough, it's taking longer than i'd like to get used to this whole, 'my mum now lives abroad' thing, apaz turkey is amazing, she's having a great time, our cats however are apparantly somewhere in greece, i think she's not telling me something, as everytime i ask her about when they're arriving, it's always, 'oh, in a few days', so i think they may have died in transit, plus she's lied to me about this stuff before, like when our last cat was 'at the vet' for about a year before i finally clicked as to what had happened, so all in all today has been a crappy end to a crappy week. god, i sound so depressed, me thinks i have been listening to too much death cab for cutie....

k, the techies have reached a new level of annoying, they are now reading all the livejournals from coll they can find, bah, bad techies *pokes techies again*, this is frustating, as now have to friend lock anything even remotely personal, bah.

tom phoned me again in one of his non-technical modes, well more like phoned me repeatedly for about half an hour over lunchtime, it seems he has once again forgotten how to copy files and music on to his computer.

Tom: so what letters do i press?
Me: you hold down ctrl, then A, C, and V.
Tom: okay, A....C...and what?
Me: *slaps forehead with palm* press v.
Tom: ok, got it, thanks
*puts down phone*
*phone rings again two minutes later*
Tom: Well, i did what you said...
Me: and...
Tom: Well, it took so long to copy that i forgot it again....
Me: *repeatedly hits head against wall* A....C....V
Tom: okay, let me just try, can you hang on a sec...
*ten minute wait while he tries to locate three damn keys on the keyboard*

and then the conversation continued in much the same way for at least another 15 minutes, with him phoning me a total of 6 times with in the half an hour period, at least my mum wont let him ring me like that again from turkey, too expensive...she goes in like 12 hours, and i will officially be living alone...crazy much. x.

that was just a bad end to a very bad day, have been so clumsy it's ridiculous, my poor head, have hit it three times, as well as being hit in the head by a netball. thrown by the f***king teacher. now have a nice red eye that hurts when ever i: laugh. smile. cry. frown... basically whenever i show any emotion on my face that involves the movement of my facial muscles. bah. bad sport. 

damn emma, has now got me into another tv show. hate having an addictive personality.

aaaahhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh...rant over. promise.

what i will be telling my parents: wow, yeah, chem went okay...
in actual fact it possibly couldn't have gone worse. i hate partial pressure, i hate organic, i hate the whole bloody lot. anyway enough of that, i have too much revision to even think about.

last night was, well, interesting! firstly found a brilliant website, www.effingpot.com, it's a british guide for americans, and let's just say it's wrong, very wrong, and not just in the way that they have the wrong definitions of stuff, we apparantly have very dirty expressions that are used daily, i mean what do you really think 'keep your pecker up' means? as well as the millions of ways of describing sex and getting drunk, we are a very dirty county indeed.

this was soon followed by a large number of jokes about vicky holding a hard drive and all the really wrong meanings associated with that sentence, i'm sorry, i can't help it, when i'm tired my mind really does pick up the dirty things in everything, plus it wasn't just me who was making the associations. someone should really record our conversations for amusement sake.

no-one should ever give emma coffee. last night emma had, what can only be described as a mini meltdown, running round, crawling on the floor, doing forward rolls off her bed and hitting the wall repeatedly, it was really amusing til she told me i hiccuped like a moose. her life goals shifted remarkably, first from wanting  to live in a nunnery, where i still maintain she wouldn't last very long at all, and then she decided she was going to give up school, become a basket weaver, in, i think we finally decided on tanzania, and i was going to be her assistant cause i am too retarded to make them myself. all this to get away from doing biology! 

alas, geography revision awaits, as does worrying about what to wear to an oscar themed party on friday night, am screwed, more than three days notice would have been helpful as i need clothes and shoes...all of which are at home....

i hate my friends. i have tried to avoid having a large number of excruciatingly bad photos of me floating around, and have mostly suceeded, apart from prom where there was an incident with a camera and me pulling a really silly face that i'd kinda like to forget, but of course has a tendency to reappear around the time of my birthday every year, therefore am slightly pissed that after consuming alcohol i did some very embarrasing stuff which was of course recorded on a video phone for all to see, *pokes tamara, vicky and alice*, not entirely sure who's idea it was...damn them. now have to wait for them to finsih watching their movie on my laptop before can go to sleep...

tv should just die, i don't like this whole one episode a week thing, i'm more used to watching all the episodes in one go, that's how i watched gilmore girls, grey's, vm etc. none of my ships are going right, derek and meredith are distressingly still apart, and i watched the trailer for next weeks gilmore girls and it's painful, very painful, and veronica mars, the fact that it's not on for another two weeks is killing me, i think emma may also kill me by then, cause i know spoilers, and i have a tendency to not be able to keep my mouth shut, as hard as i might try, sorry ems, i don't mean it really, today has just been a really bad day, and the whole chem test tomorrow is enough to kill me. hate chem, hate, hate, hate it, actually i really don't like any of my subjects especially maths. i have maths prep. bad mood. still ill. bah

Merry Christmas and a Happy New Year to everyone.
haven't written here in ages but am tired and can't be fucked to write a lot. got back from egypt on friday, really interesting trip, etc etc...no i mean it was good, but 10 days of constant travelling right after the end of school was exhausting. still don't know if i want to go to uni in september or take a gap year...hate potentially life changing decisions...have so much work, have to do my year book page and at the mo am drawing blanks on what to put, maybe will leave the page blank...wow that leads me to a very depressing thought path about my time at coll, entirely inappropriate for christmas day i feel...have to start packing up my room soon, as i don't want to come back for exeat so this will be my only oppurtunity, and although my mum officially knows i have been smoking, (whole other story about that one) there are still somethings she better not see...alcohol bottles for one...everyone had better come and visit me, thankfully i'm still in hartley wintney, but the only good thing about this whole move to me living with tom above the pet shop on the high street is the fact that tom won't be there during the week as he'll be on this crazy course, there are no close neighbours living around there and my mum will be several thousand miles away in turkey. i have such a brilliant relationship with my parents...i never see my dad, i'll see my mum for a few days three times a year, and my step-dad i'll see roughly every three weeks...

got a really rude e-mail from this guy who couldn't accept the fact that i had never heard of him and he had e-mailed the wrong nicola maddox, i guess it's hardly a common surname,but it's still getting rather annoying, so i sent a rude e-mail back and pressed on with my task of getting the username nicolamaddox to as many internet places as possible, after ll i'm older, she was the one who got the e-mail address similar to mine not the other way around, i sent her an e-mail actually asking her to correct her friends, but apparantly to no avail...

wow, end of term, can't believe it's already over, it's gone very fast, it's also gone very badly, but that's beside the point. At the beginning of the term, my mum hadn't even thought about moving to turkey, me and tom still argued ALL the time, i really didn't talk to any of the glenlees and i still hadn't applied to uni. it hasn't been all bad i guess.

if any body is interested

Dear Santa...

Dear Santa,

This year I've been busy!

In October I helped see the light (8 points). In November I pushed in the mud (-17 points). In January I helped, hide a body (-5000 points). Last Thursday I put money in 's expired parking meter (14 points). Last Wednesday I bought porn for (10 points).

Overall, I've been naughty (-4995 points). For Christmas I deserve a lump of coal!

Sincerely,
nicolamaddox

well i have had a fun year!! one boring part however was the conference yesterday, endless talking about god knows what, we couldn't even here, and just when was amusing myself with bluetooth and sending stuff around the hall, my darling phone bloody well ran out of battery, however the saviour that nis my ipod lasted the whole day thank god, and was amused by dancing to aqua, was very special. has some very spec photos from the day seeing as how her camera phone was always right there, not pleased that she got one of me and scas asleep, and i do still want one of those houses... however highlight of the day was finishing gone with the wind finally, 1010 pages, am triumphant, if i can spell it right. have to say though katherine was right, is a reasonably annoying book, but am glad i finished it, annoyingly though sometimes i just get books that niggle at me afterwards and this seems to be one, nit really satisfied with the ending particularly, but then am a sucker for happy endings, and this one, well, wasn't.

have finally managed to shed the headache that came out as a result of last night, and my speech has just about returned to normal, really amusingly today though i did fall off this step thing on the way out of prayers which made me crack up, but then spent the next hour asleep in the common room to try and fully recover from last night before my driving lesson, however said driving lesson is now no longer happening, so angry with her, and am also getting more and more scared about my test, as really think i will fail, but now also think i might crash the mg i am going to be driving tomorrow, however, must not let this flip me out, otherwise will be a wreck tomorrow....

well, yesterday i wasn't too excited about the concert, i should have been but i think i was just overly tired, and the waiting around both outside and inside the hexagon really wasn't helping, but then the doors opened...and i made a complete fool out of myself, i tripped over this little step thing, and went flying into the steel barrier. i think it was pay back for me laughing quite so much at vicky, who yesterday told me the very amusing story of her falling off her chair backwards, however, i now have a very sore toe and a bruise on my stomach from when i went down head first, but to console myself, someone did the exact same thing a few minutes later, the only difference was that she went straight into me as opposed to a hard chunk of metal. anyway, the concert was amazing. first we had the support act called, 'the boy least likely to' and they were really good, really want t try and get their cd, then of course, james blunt came on, and he was absolutely incredible. he sung all the ones from his album, as well as a load of other ones that we didn't recognise, no broavery was really sad cause he showed this video obviously from when he was a soldier like in a foreign country, and it was really moving. anyway after the show, he did a signing, and i got hi autograph, and a picture taken with him, will post photos from the show later and finish updating...

this is my first post as an 18 year old, can't believe am supposed to be an adult! what a joke! thanks to jen, emma and vicky who came to my room to wish me happy birthday, and caris who didn't succeed in her mission to be the first to wish me happy birthday, although she was close, thanks! now, must sleep!

where before things were bad for mummy, things are now getting remarkably worse for me. when she suggested moving away from the village, i thought to like fleet or hook, or somewhere in the vicinity, however what my mum meant was lets move hundreds of miles to god knows where. at the moment she's thinking of the north yorkshire moors, and no offense to people who live there but that is so far away from my whole life it's ridiculous. my whole family is moving abroad, and those that are remaining in the uk live in berkshire, is it so hard to ask that i am at least within a reasonable distance to them? i know i have plans to go to uni somewhere up north, but going to uni, and having our family home there is another matter, my home is in hampshire. why does she have this desire for me to spend my time in the middle of nowhere, i'm going to be living there more, not her. i'm being selfish i know, but you don't just spring this on a person. last time i spoke to her we were going to keep the house, possibly renting it out if we needed to. not moving so far away it's practically another country

just found out today that if my mum wants to fulfil her dream of moving to turkey and setting up this hotel then we have to sell our house in hw, the house my granny bought before she died, and move away from the village in which my family has lived for the last 40 years, and where i grew up, went to school, where we had our first house when we moved away from daddy, and so on, i really can;t believe it, it's just house prices there are so expensive right now. thing is, mummy really wants this, and i'm not going to kick up a fuss about it, i mean i'll hopefully be off at uni soon. she doesn't want to move either, may be quite exciting, but i have issues when it comes to letting go of houses, my main aim in life is still to buy back the house granny sold so i could come to damn coll. i feel awful that she had to sell it, the house she lived in for 30 years, since she moved up from wales, just so i could come to this stupid school which has ridiculous school fees. hate money.
on a happier note: it's my 18th birthday tomorrow!!

why do people suddenly seem to think i am good at following instructions, i'm just not, and i think my past record really verifies that, 'hand your prep in on monday...,' now you know that's going to be given in on wednesday at the earliest, 'nicola, don't smoke...,' whoops, 'nicola, stop smoking...,' whoops again, and the list goes on so why do people still seem surprised when i haven't done as they asked, but then again, why do people still bother asking. i don't mean to be unreliable, it's just the way i an, and at this point i don't think anything is going to change, i mean, even stuff i tell myself to do, still doesn't get done like not leaving prep to the last minute, and getting up in the morning more than five minutes before we have to be at school,so it seems completely pointless to actually be making resolutions for the year following my birthday, it never has before, but i feel i should at least try.
1. stop smoking, really really bad habit that must be stopped
2. drink less alcohol, strange that as i turn 18 i'm trying to cut down, i have to say this one i feel probably wont work.
3. at least don't spend all money on alcohol, must start saving money, have just realised if i am living at home alone when my parent's are in turkey, i'm going to have to save my money, so i can, oh i dunno, eat.
4. really, really don't leave work till the last minute, this i feel is the least likely to work out of al of them is the one i am most likely to fail at, have been telling myself this for the last 7 years to no avail, for example am sitting here on a sunday night, procrastinating, with loads of prep and knowing full well that i have no intention of working on monday and tuesday night, but this thought still isn't enough for me to get up and actually do anything, wow, i really need to grow up at some point. 

think those are enough for now, will add in more if i feel the need.
bit bummed out at the mo, mum didn't have the best news from the investors, really home she can sort this out, it's an amazing oppurtunity.
also found out today that my village, darling hartley wintney does infact have a weekly street market, consisting of roughly 4 stalls, i cannot wait to go home and mock it mercilessly, apparantly having a 'community orchard' wasn't enough, or the repetitive village fete which is the same every year, it has to go one step further and introduce a street market,i mean come on. but i have to say i am very fond of my dear village, mum's mention of buying a house cloer to wherever i am at uni feel on outraged ears, and the thought of, instead of them buying a house, they just stay with me at uni whenever they're back here, really did have me completely outraged, unfortunately there really is no polite way of saying, 'really? are you kidding me, that would be hell.' but it was decided that we would talk about that closer to the time, thankfully i don't have to worry about me being homeless just yet.
am off to battle with my hair, after having it cut so short, it has gone about a million times curlier and it's annoying cause it doesn't tie up properly so am going to attack it with hair straighteners as another form of procrastination.

'lonely planet.' i have to say those two words have haunted me since the expedition, i think i actually had a few nightmsres there too, but never did i think i would hear those words ever EVER again, that was until a certain, crazy gap year person came into WWH hall today, high kicks and all, and i think every other word out of his mouth was '...lonely planet' it was insane, i had severe flash backs, that combined with the malibu and cokes last night, which just made me feel like i was back at kipepeo again, it was bizarre.
i have to say in the last few days i have participated more in coll activities, i went to a chamber music concert last night, and rachel and alice were so surprised to see me there, so not me...unfortunately they couldn't also persuade me to go to the holy communion service too, that was pushing it a bit too far i feel. then of course we participated in some extra-curricular drinking, which is always fun, got really dizzy again, nearly walked into several people in my attempt to walk in a straight line. alison worried that we were actually buying too much alcohol, that the bottle was too big and would be a waste, but between the four of us we managed to finish the whole, rather large bottle of malibu which i thought was an impressive feat, couldn't sleep afterwards due to the large about of cola we drunk the malibu with, so lay awake for several hours. 
carrying on with the whole coll participation thing, attended the talk by johnathan porrit this afternoon, about development and it's affect on the environment in the past and in the future, which was really interesting, goes with the whole geography thing i think, whilst of course the whole ucas thing is still kinda sucking to be honest, got a meeting with mrs revell on monday, and still have to cut 200 characters out of my personal statement, whilst doing two geog essays, but you know, none of this really matters cause...it's my birthday on tuesday!!! (although i do have a maths test on the same day) and i fully intend on spending tomorrow sleeping as the next few weeks are going to be mental, st. andrews open day, going to turkey to look at property, driving test, ucas, etc...the list goes on, as does my babbling it seems...

mr smart (a.k.a. the handy man) is my god, i love mr smart, he has opened the door to my room, and i am happy....i love mr smart, although i really don't think he's that fond of me having him called out on a sunday night!!
